result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs, PAC>=0.15 (1st). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs, PAC>=0.15 (1st) was dismissed by the court.

  • Clarence W Mitten IV was found guilty of OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Clarence W Mitten IV was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine of $1,100.00 plus costs totaling $2,175.00.

14 days in jail with 14 days on Electronic Monitoring if approved by the jail administration and RISK assessment.
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.
Can be served in Portage or Wood County.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $100 plus costs including the DNA surcharge. 
  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Continue with his outpatient treatment that he is currently involved in following his inpatient programming. 
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by his agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clarence W Mitten IV

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Clarence W Mitten IV in court with attorney Harold C. Wolfgram. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:28 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Counts 1 & 5 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 & 5.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 2 & 4 are dismissed outright. 
Count 3 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Wolfgram makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
28 days jail
14 days in jail with 14 days on Electronic Monitoring if approved by the jail administration and RISK assessment.
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.
Can be served in Portage or Wood County. 
Pay $1,100 fine plus costs totaling $2,175.00 plus $26.45 blood draw fee. 
18 months revocation
18 months IID
DOT Assessment and comply with all treatment recommendations. 

Count 5 -
180 days jail - STAYED -
Huber if approved by the jail administration. 
First half in jail with the second half on Electronic Monitoring, if approved by jail administration and the RISK assessment.
Placed on probation for a period of 12 months: 
$100 fine plus costs including the DNA surcharge
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Continue with his outpatient treatment that he is currently invovled in following his inpatient programming.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Maintain fulltime employment. 
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by his agent.

records.addlTxt:
Maintain absolute sobriety while driving. 
Have valid DL at all times while driving. 
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *On all court dates.

Defendant Clarence W Mitten IV in court with attorney Harold C. Wolfgram. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY pleas entered.

State recommends a signature bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Wolfgram asks for an extension for motions until 10 days after the pre-trial. 
Atty Knaapen does not object. 
BY THE COURT:  Granted.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
